strats.name: Moat Leave With Grapple Teleport
note: Hold angle-up, jump, bonk the ceiling, and use Grapple just before landing.
Moonwalk into the transition on the same frame that the Grapple Beam reaches the Grapple block.
Continue holding Grapple through the door transition to initiate a teleport in the next room.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: This avoids collecting the item.

strats.name: Shinespark Above Item
strats.devNote: Sparking in top position means the item will be avoided.

strats.name: Moat SpringBall Bounce, Run Through the Door
strats.note: Run, jump, lateral midair morph on the way down, then bounce off the pedestal to get to the other side.

strats.name: Moat SpringBall Bounce, Open Doorway
strats.note: Open the door and step as close to the transition as possible. Run, jump, lateral midair morph on the way down, then bounce off the pedestal to get to the other side.

strats.name: Moat Continuous Walljump, Run Through the Door
note: Aligning against the closed door shell on the other side of the transition.
Run towards the water and jump on the last possible frame.
Perform the CWJ off of the item pedestal to cross to the other side.

strats.name: Moat Continuous Walljump, Open Doorway
note: Stand on the farthest pixel into the door possible using moonwalk, X-Ray, or morphball turn around.
Run towards the water and jump on the last possible frame.
Perform the CWJ off of the item pedestal to cross to the other side.

strats.name: G-mode Morph HBJ or Ceiling Bomb Jump
Hero Shot Spark Above Item
note: Run and jump, fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.
strats.devNote: Sparking in top position means the item will be avoided.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Come in Getting Blue Speed, Leave With Temporary Blue (Speedy Jump)
note: Enter with enough speed to jump over all the water, morphing mid-air and then unmorphing into temporary blue.

strats.name: Come in Getting Blue Speed, Leave With Temporary Blue (Insane Speedy Jump)
note: Enter with enough speed to jump over all the water, morphing mid-air and then unmorphing into temporary blue.
Morph just before hitting the ceiling, in order to extend the jump horizontally.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This jump is much easier without HiJump or Speedbooster equipped.

strats.name: Hero Shot Spark Through Item
note: Run and jump, fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot is at a specific position before sparking.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.
strats.devNote: Sparking in bottom position means the item will be collected along the way.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: This avoids collecting the item.
strats.devNote: Several other strats would also be possible for avoiding the item.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue (Speedy Jump)
note: Enter with enough speed to jump onto or over the item pedestal, morphing mid-air and then unmorphing into temporary blue.

strats.name: Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.
Samus will not be visible during the climb.

strats.name: Moat Reverse Jump
note: Execution of this strat is non-trivial, and failing will lead to falling into the pit.
Depending on item loadout, that could be a softlock.
strats.devNote: Could use a failure definition?

strats.name: Moat Reverse Jump, Run Through Door
note: Execution of this strat is non-trivial, and failing will lead to falling into the pit.
Depending on item loadout, that could be a softlock.

strats.name: Shinespark Through Item
strats.devNote: This will grab the item and continue the spark to the left door. If this is an E-Tank, Samus will not maintain full Energy after the next strat.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge to Item (Come in Shinecharging)
note: After gaining a shinecharge, run back to the door to make space for a running jump to the left.

strats.name: Carry Shinecharge to Item (Come in Shinecharged)
Hero Shot Spark Through Item
note: Run, fire a shot mid-air, jump, and activate a mid-air shinespark to the left.
Sparking too late will cause the shot to despawn before reaching the door.
Sparking too early will cause Samus to bonk the door as it will not yet be open.
A beam shot, Missile, or Super can be used.

strats.name: Continue Shinespark Left
strats.devNote: This will continue the Shinespark from the right door. This is needed in case the item is an E-Tank, Samus will not maintain full Energy after the Spark.

strats.name: Continue Hero Shot Shinespark Left
strats.devNote: This will continue the Shinespark from the right door. This is needed in case the item is an E-Tank, Samus will not maintain full Energy after the Spark.

strats.name: Continue Shinecharge, Leave With Spark
note: From the pedestal, fire a shot to the left to open the door.
If needed, jump slightly to the left to follow the shot, then activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot hits the door before sparking.
strats.devNote: If approaching from the right, the camera will be scrolled further, making it unnecessary to jump and follow the shot.

strats.name: Continue Shinecharge into Diagonal Spark
note: Jump from the pedestal to the right, and shinespark diagonally to make it past the water.

strats.name: Continue Shinecharge, Leave With Spark
note: From the pedestal, jump to the right to bring the door on-camera.
Fire a shot mid-air, and activate the shinespark wind-up.
Wait until the shot hits the door before sparking.
strats.devNote: If approaching from the right, the camera will be scrolled further, requiring a larger jump to prevent the shot from despawning.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit by Kihunter
Grapple Teleport X-Ray Climb
note: Exit the previous room with Samus in a standing pose (while grappled).
After teleporting, press right to release Grapple while staying standing (not being forced into a crouch).
Then X-ray climb to get up to the door transition, without needing to open the door.

strats.name: Leave Space Jumping
devNote: FIXME: A longer runway could be used if getting blue speed.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit by Kihunter
Base
note: Jump and aim down to lower the camera to see where the crabs are.
Alternatively use a Power Bomb to kill them or risk tanking a hit.

strats.name: Crateria Kihunter Room Ice Moonfall Door Lock Skip
note: Freeze the two Scisers to set up a moonfall between them, and aim down.

Hold left to move to the right at the correct time, which will set up an automatic turn-around, allowing Samus to clip past the floating platform below, past the door shell, and through the transition.
The amount of speed required is highly precise.

strats.name: Shinespark
strats.note: Enter on the right side of the doorway to reduce the amount of energy used.
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit by Thawing Sciser
note: Run from the ledge into the open doorway while hitting the frozen Crab as it thaws and the door transition simultaneously.
Note that this requires a pixel perfect freeze, a small pixel starting window, and has tight timing. It then has a 50% success rate due to collision oscillation.

32.name: West Ocean
32.note: The section between Bowling Alley Path and Bowling Alley is excluded from West Ocean and considered as its own room instead (Homing Geemer Room)

nodes.name: Upper Right Section - Top Right Door
Upper Right Section - Bottom Right Door
Bridge Left Door (Same Connection as Lower Section - Bottom Left Door)
note: This door can only be accessed with the use of glitchy techniques.
Graphically it aligns with the Left Door of Homing Geemer Room, but surprisingly it leads to the same location as the Lower Section - Bottom Left Door of West Ocean.

nodes.name: Bridge Right Door (Same Connection as Lower Section - Bottom Right Door)
note: This door can only be accessed with the use of glitchy techniques.
Graphically it aligns with the Right Door of Homing Geemer Room, but surprisingly it leads to the same location as the Lower Section - Bottom Right Door of West Ocean.

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction (By Left Door)
nodes.note: Represents being at the Moat door with G-Mode and morph or artificial morph

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Overloaded PLMs Junction (By Left Door)
nodes.note: Represents being at the Moat door with G-Mode, PLMs overloaded, and morph or artificial morph

nodes.name: G-Mode Morph Junction Direct (By Left Door)
nodes.note: Represents being at the Moat door with G-Mode and morph or artificial morph, in direct G-Mode

devNote: It's possible to stop half-way by shooting open the door that appears to lead to Bowling Alley
This has limited usefulness, because this door actually leads to the same transition as the bottom right door (to the Wrecked Ship Entrance).
Likewise the door on the left, which appears to lead to Bowling Alley Path, actually leads to the same transition as the bottom left door (to the Moat).
There is a potential application by using this runway to the right, as it is longer than the one in front of the bottom right door.
FIXME: add nodes to represent the doors that appear to lead left and right to Bowling Alley Path and Bowling Alley, and add a similar strat leading there.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Neutral Bounce)
note: Do a neutral bounce (lateral mid-air morph into not holding jump while landing) into an uncontrolled bounce.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip Through the Bridge
note: Moonfall onto the Homing Geemer walkway twice to clip all the way down into the ocean below.
The Moonfall must be performed at the very edge of the slope so that Samus fully falls to the lower area.
The first Moonfall will clip into the slope above the walkway, and the second Moonfall will clip all the way through.
Pose changing can send Samus inside of the walkway, where the right door connects to the WS main entrance door, and the left door connects to the Moat door.

strats.name: Stored Moonfall Clip Into the Bridge
note: Moonfall onto the Homing Geemer walkway twice to clip down into the bridge below.
The Moonfall must be performed at the very edge of the slope so that Samus fully falls to the lower area.
The first Moonfall will clip into the slope above the walkway, and the second Moonfall will clip all the way through.
Pose changing will allow Samus to remain inside of the bridge, where the right door connects to the WS main entrance door, and the left door connects to the Moat door.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Blue Space Jump)
note: Time a Space Jump immediately after clearing the last set of Grapple blocks.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Jumps)
Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Bounce)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Crystal Flash
strats.devNote: This is to represent the ability to Crystal Flash after coming in jumping, shooting open the door, and landing in the door frame.

strats.name: Carry G-Mode Morph Back Through
strats.devNote: Artificial morph will allow Samus not to fall; real Morph is not sufficient.

strats.name: Hero Shot Spark
note: While falling out the door, swing out to the left a couple tiles before moving back right, in order to make the camera scroll.
Run, jump, fire a shot mid-air, and activate a well-timed mid-air shinespark to make it through the door.

strats.name: West Ocean - G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb into the Bridge
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: West Ocean - Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb into the Bridge
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: West Ocean - Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb into the Bridge
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 1 screen, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 2 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 4 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 3 screens.

strats.name: Very Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
note: Enter with G-mode direct, back up to between 1 and 6 pixels from the door transition, and activate X-ray to get very deep stuck in the door.
Climb up 3 screens, and perform a turnaround buffered spin-jump away from the door to trigger the transition, bypassing any lock on the door.

strats.name: IBJ from the Platforms
strats.note: Jump into an IBJ while avoiding the Ripper, or start an IBJ from the platform to the left and boost horizontally at the top.

strats.name: Health Conscious Shinespark
strats.note: Jump to the submerged platform, then jump again.

strats.name: West Ocean Grapple Fling
strats.note: Attach to the ripper when it is all the way left.  Build momentum and launch Heavensward.

strats.name: West Ocean Grapple Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Grapple on the Ripper to get inside the wall under the door.
Do a Crystal Flash to force a standup.
X-Ray climb up to the door transition.
strats.devNote: TODO: There may be Bob strats to skip the Crystal Flash requirement.

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Bounce)
Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
West Ocean - G-Mode Setup Lure Zeb from Below (to Top Right Section - Top Right Door)
note: Start from the Middle Right Door next to the Zeb farm.
While standing on the right of the Zeb farm, freeze the Zeb while it is still moving up and facing to the right.
Quickly go through the morph tunnel with a Bomb, Power Bomb, or Spring Ball, and get onto the small floating platform just above the Zeb farm.
After the Zeb is visible, freeze it and jump on top of it. Use the Zeb as a platform to climb high enough to get it to be aligned with the door.
Use the background to see how high the Zeb is - Get the Zeb 2-3 tiles higher than the thinner bright line in the background.
Note that if the Zeb is unfrozen and off screen horizontally it will despawn, but if it's off screen vertically it will not.
Chase the Zeb towards the doorway, refreezing it as needed.

strats.name: West Ocean - G-Mode Setup Lure Zeb from Below (to Top Right Section - Bottom Right Door)
note: Start from the Middle Right Door next to the Zeb farm.
While standing on the right of the Zeb farm, freeze the Zeb while it is still moving up and facing to the right.
Quickly go through the morph tunnel with a Bomb, Power Bomb, or Spring Ball, and get onto the small floating platform just above the Zeb farm.
After the Zeb is visible, fall off the platform to make the Zeb move horizontally at the right height to hit Samus in the doorway to the right.
Note that if the Zeb is unfrozen and off screen horizontally it will despawn, but if it's off screen vertically it will not.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Zeb
note: Freeze the Zeb from the right while jumping in order to freeze it at the correct height, noting that it will raise 1 more pixel when it thaws.
While standing to the left of it, refreeze it again. Keep a half-tile gap between the Zeb and the runway in order to extend the runway as much as possible.
strats.devNote: The Zeb can be used to extend the runway at 2 and 3, but that requires a blind and precise positioning (and is not very useful at 3).

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get Hit by Zeb
Base
strats.note: The shot blocks can be destroyed without using bombs

strats.name: X-Ray Standup
strats.note: Unmorph and shoot the shot block, then x-ray standup, partial floor clip, and down grab to escape.

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost with Ice
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Freeze the bug at the correct height, such that it will move and be able to hit Samus while in the morph tunnel.
While in the first two-tile tall region, shoot and refreeze the bug. Then go to the second two-tile region and shoot the block.
Return and lure the bug such that it hits Samus and boosts her up and onto the ledge to escape.
Be careful not to despawn the enemy by moving it off camera, except while it is frozen. This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.
strats.devNote: Could use a failure definition?

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost with Wave or Spazer
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Shoot the block with Wave or while crouching with Spazer before luring the bug.
Quickly lure the bug then use a mockball on the 4 tile floor before the tunnel.
This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.
strats.devNote: Could use a failure definition?

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Boost
note: Get a Zeb to move left into the morph passage, and reach the end of the tunnel before it.
Must be quick enough to shoot the shot block first. Requires a mockball on the 4 tile floor before the tunnel.
This strat is a one-shot try and failure is a softlock.
strats.devNote: Could use a failure definition?

strats.name: West Ocean Bug Ice Clip
note: Freeze a bug three tiles to the right of the morph tunnel entrance, directly under the tile where ceiling is higher.
Jump onto the bug, crouch, and jump up.
The bug must be at a very precise pixel height unless using  XRay and Morph.
Note that although the ceiling here is 3 tiles thick, only the bottom tile is solid; the other two are slopes pushing Samus up, allowing the trick to be done.
strats.devNote: This location does not work at the high pixel location, as Samus is forced into a crouch, likely because of the slope tiles above?

strats.name: G-mode Morph X-Ray Standup
strats.note: Unmorph and cancel g-mode, shoot the shot block, then x-ray standup, partial floor clip, and down grab to the ledge. Wiggle to escape.

strats.name: G-Mode Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Shinespark Deep Stuck X-Ray Climb
strats.note: Climb up 1 screen.

strats.name: Leave With Runway, Both Doors Open
Leave With Runway, Both Doors Open
Base
devNote: This is to go below through the bottom path, past the bomb block, to avoid the need to do a mid-air morph to use the top path.
This strat is also used to return below if in G-mode, to avoid canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: Camera Maniuplation
note: Crouch and shoot the shot blocks from afar. There is enough time to get past them without Gravity before they respawn.
If the shot blocks do not break, roll all the way to the left to reset the camera, then go back.

strats.name: West Ocean Shinespark, Morph Tunnel Rush
note: Preopen the door and shotblock, then go back and charge a shinespark.
Springball through the short morphball tunnel to just have enough time to shinespark out the door.

strats.name: West Ocean - Enemy Stuck Moonfall into the Bridge
note: Watch the middle Tripper move until it reaches the rightmost platform and then move it off camera.
Move to the Zeb Spawner and freeze the bug as it is rising and facing right.
Travel through the Morph tunnel and wait above the Zeb.
Once it rises to the correct height, let it start moving right.
Freeze the Zeb and the Tripper above the Bridge and perform the Enemy Stuck Moonfall.
Move off after building enough fall speed and wiggle back and forth to clip through the Bridge and land inside.
strats.devNote: FIXME: A [6, 8] version of this strat is possible with slightly different requirements but is more difficult.

strats.name: Climb the Trippers Bootless
note: Jump on the left platforms to get the middle Tripper on screen, luring it to the right.
Get on the middle Tripper and use it to jump to the item. This requires a somewhat precise shot and jump, particularly if the top Tripper is in the way.
The jump and shot can be easier and done at the apex of a single jump starting with a crouch. Freezing the Trippers can make this much easier.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The super block respawns.
devNote: This obstacle is to represent shooting the super block and is only used in quickly returning after grabbing the item.
It is necessary because there is a g-mode strat to get to 14.

strats.name: West Ocean - Enemy Stuck Moonfall Super Block Clip
note: Watch the lowest Tripper move until it reaches the left side wall and then move it off camera.
Move to the Zeb Spawner and freeze the bug as it is rising and facing left.
Travel through the Morph tunnel and wait above the Zeb.
Once it rises to about halfway up the floating platform, let it start moving left.
Freeze the Zeb and the Tripper above the Super Block and perform the Enemy Stuck Moonfall.
Move off after building enough fall speed and aim down to clip through the Super block.
strats.devNote: FIXME: A [6, 14] version of this strat is possible with slightly different requirements but is more difficult.

strats.name: Ocean Floor Shinecharge, Spark Left
strats.note: Jump to the runway connected to the left side door before sparking.

strats.name: West Ocean Floor Shinecharge, Fast Wallclimb to Gravity Door
strats.note: Use walljumps to climb from the ocean floor up to the gravity suit room door.

strats.name: West Ocean Floor Shinecharge, Fast Spacejump Wallclimb to Gravity Door
strats.note: Spacejump out of the water then use walljumps up to the gravity suit room door.

strats.name: West Ocean Platforming
strats.note: It may be best to have shorter, later jumps to prevent bonking the ceiling or hitting the Ripper.

strats.name: Gravity Suit
strats.devNote: A speedy jump would be obsoleted by another strat for being tricky.

strats.name: Ocean Floor Jump Assist Shinecharge Right
Ocean Floor Precise Walljump Shinespark Right
Over Ocean Spark, Through the Door
strats.note: Open the right door before sparking to spark out of it.
devNote: The right door could be an obstacle, but with this shinecharge, a careful jump is probably fair to include.
This room is already pretty complex, so adding an obstacle is fairly significant.

strats.name: Base
strats.devNote: Turning off Gravity and HiJump can make this mid-air morph easier.

strats.name: Base
strats.note: The super block respawns.

strats.name: Beat West Ocean Super Block Respawn
strats.note: It's possible to go down, grab the item, and return before the Super block respawns, if going quick enough.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs by Bombing Crumble Block with Space Jump
strats.note: The crumble block is the leftmost flat ceiling tile.

strats.name: G-mode Overload PLMs by Bombing Crumble Block
strats.note: Start the IBJ on the second downward tile from the door. The crumble block is the leftmost flat ceiling tile.
strats.devNote: Without canCeilingBombJump, this would take more than 10 minutes.

strats.name: West Ocean G-mode Overload PLMs by PBing Missile Item
note: To overload the PLMs, place a PB precisely to the right of the bottom of the second overhang above the door to the Moat.
This is at the max jump height without HiJump. Placing the PB higher or lower will not overload the PLMs without many PBs.
strats.devNote: This link is used to get the item and return, so there is no canRiskPermanentLossOfAccess.

strats.name: West Ocean G-mode Overload PLMs by PBing Missile Item Softlock Risk
note: To overload the PLMs, place a PB precisely to the right of the bottom of the second overhang above the door to the Moat.
This is at the max jump height without HiJump. Placing the PB higher or lower will not overload the PLMs without many PBs.

33.name: Bowling Alley Path

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Choot
strats.note: Freeze the Choot near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.

strats.name: Leave With Runway, Suitless - Frozen Choot
strats.note: Freeze the Choot near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
strats.devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Double Frozen Choot Runway (Left)
note: Freeze two Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway.
Freeze each near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Standing between two Choots then precisely timing a crouched angle shot can help with the timing. A buffered X-Ray shot may also help.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Double Frozen Choot Runway, Suitless (Left)
note: Freeze two Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway.
Freeze each near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Standing between two Choots then precisely timing a crouched angle shot can help with the timing. A buffered X-Ray shot may also help.
strats.devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Triple Frozen Choot Runway (Left)
note: Freeze all three Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway and run across the entire room.
Freeze each immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Jump between two of them and wait for them to fall and start to rise again, taking one Choot hit in the process.
This will give Samus just enough time to shoot them both and jump and freeze the third and barely be able to use the runway before they thaw.
With this runway, Samus can then get a suitless, in-room shinecharge, with just a 1-tap.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Triple Frozen Choot Runway, Suitless (Left)
note: Freeze all three Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway and run across the entire room.
Freeze each immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Jump between two of them and wait for them to fall and start to rise again, taking one Choot hit in the process.
This will give Samus just enough time to shoot them both and jump and freeze the third and barely be able to use the runway before they thaw.
With this runway, Samus can then get a suitless, in-room shinecharge, with just a 1-tap.
devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.
Although there is a longer runway available for shinecharging, this is an equivalent for how fast Samus can leave the room.
It shouldn't be a problem, as this length should be enough for shinecharging at this difficulty.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get hit by Waver
Plasma Hero Shot Spark

unlocksDoors.devNote: FIXME: Using a Super seems extremely awkward but possible; add a higher-level tech requirement here.

note: Fire a Plasma shot while running into the room, jump and activate the shinespark wind-up mid-air.
Wait to spark right until just as the Plasma shot goes off screen.

strats.name: Shinecharged DamageBoost
note: Use a Waver to damage boost across part of the room, then pass through any remaining enemies while IFrames are active.
Killing the first waver and damage boosting with the second may be easier.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Move quickly to the right, either dodging the enemies or using them to damage boost.
Shoot open the door and spark through.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed
note: Freeze each of the three Choot enemies at the correct pixel height to walk across the room.
Be careful about taking damage or falling on slopes.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
note: Freeze each of the three Choot enemies at the correct pixel height to walk across the room.
Be careful about taking damage or falling on slopes.

strats.name: Leave With Spark (Come In Shinecharged, Plasma)

unlocksDoors.devNote: FIXME: Using a Super seems very awkward but possible; add a higher-level tech requirement here.

note: Run into the room, and just before Samus would run into the water, fire a Plasma shot and make a big jump across the room.
The shot should clear the enemies and open the door.
Activate the shinespark mid-air.

strats.name: Leave With Spark (Come In Shinecharged, ScrewAttack)
note: Run and jump through the room with Screw Attack.
As the door starts to come on camera, shoot it open, carefully avoiding enemies from blocking the shot.
Jump and activate the shinespark mid-air.

strats.name: Plasma Hero Shot Spark

unlocksDoors.devNote: FIXME: Using a Super seems extremely awkward but possible; add a higher-level tech requirement here.

note: Run into the room, and fire a Plasma shot.
Depending on the vertical position needed for the spark, either stop on a dime and activate the shinespark from the ground, or continue running and jump into a midair shinespark.
Wait to spark until just as the Plasma shot goes off screen.

strats.name: Shinecharged DamageBoost
strats.note: Jump into the Choot to damage boost across part of the room, then pass through any remaining enemies while IFrames are active.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Plasma or ScrewAttack)
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Move quickly to the left, using Plasma or Screw Attack to avoid being hit by enemies.
Shoot open the door and spark through.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Spark (Dodge Enemies)
note: Gain a shinecharge while entering the room.
Move quickly to the left, dodging the enemies.
Shoot open the door and spark through.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed
note: Freeze each of the three Choot enemies at the correct pixel height to walk across the room.
Be careful about taking damage or falling on slopes.

strats.name: Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
note: Freeze each of the three Choot enemies at the correct pixel height to walk across the room.
Be careful about taking damage or falling on slopes.

strats.name: Leave With Runway - Frozen Choot
strats.note: Freeze the Choot near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.

strats.name: Leave With Runway, Suitless - Frozen Choot
strats.note: Freeze the Choot near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
strats.devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Double Frozen Choot Runway (Right)
note: Freeze two Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway.
Freeze each near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Standing between two Choots then precisely timing a crouched angle shot can help with the timing. A buffered X-Ray shot may also help.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Double Frozen Choot Runway, Suitless (Right)
note: Freeze two Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway.
Freeze each near the end of its descent or immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Standing between two Choots then precisely timing a crouched angle shot can help with the timing. A buffered X-Ray shot may also help.
strats.devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Triple Frozen Choot Runway (Right)
note: Freeze all three Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway and run across the entire room.
Freeze each immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Jump between two of them and wait for them to fall and start to rise again, taking one Choot hit in the process.
This will give Samus just enough time to shoot them both and jump and freeze the third and barely be able to use the runway before they thaw.
With this runway, Samus can then get a suitless, in-room shinecharge, with just a 1-tap.

strats.name: Bowling Alley Path Triple Frozen Choot Runway, Suitless (Right)
note: Freeze all three Choots to significantly increase the length of the runway and run across the entire room.
Freeze each immediately after it jumps in order to be able to run onto and off of it without a problem.
Jump between two of them and wait for them to fall and start to rise again, taking one Choot hit in the process.
This will give Samus just enough time to shoot them both and jump and freeze the third and barely be able to use the runway before they thaw.
With this runway, Samus can then get a suitless, in-room shinecharge, with just a 1-tap.
devNote: The submerged tiles don't contribute to the runway length.
Although there is a longer runway available for shinecharging, this is an equivalent for how fast Samus can leave the room.
It shouldn't be a problem, as this length should be enough for shinecharging at this difficulty.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Get hit by Waver

devNote: FIXME: Add comeInShinecharging+leaveWithTemporaryBlue strats; avoiding enemies is difficult but possible.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Mockball (Space Jump)
strats.devNote: A bit higher speed can also work but would be more difficult

strats.name: Leave With Temporary Blue
note: Gain temporary blue using the runway on the left side of the room, using HiJump or a Gravity jump where needed to get onto the ocean platforms.
devNote: With very precise mid-air morphs/unmorphs, it is possible to get onto the first or second ocean platform directly without HiJump or canGravityJump, by using the runway on the right side of the room.

strats.name: Speedy Springball Jump and SpaceJump
note: Run for 7 tiles for enough speed to springball from the submerged platform up to the platform enemy, above the water.
Turning on SpeedBooster midjump, after running 7+ tiles, will automatically hit the run speed requirement.
It is not necessary to enter the water to clear the rightmost Choot.

strats.name: East Ocean Springball Bounce to the Door with SpaceJump
note: Build up run speed and then use controlled springball bounces to cross the ocean to the far right ledge, and then use SpaceJump to reach the door.
Mockball down the submerged ramp and begin SpringBall bouncing under water using the platforms.
Disable SpringBall after the final jump once Samus starts falling again as a way to gain extra speed.

strats.name: East Ocean Speedy Springball Bounce to the Door
note: Using an exact runway size of 7 tiles; use extremely precise, controlled springball bounces to cross the ocean.
7 tiles of runspeed can freely be achieved by requipping SpeedBooster after reaching the max normal run speed.
Mockball down the submerged ramp and begin SpringBall bouncing either above the water, or under water using the platforms.
The final SpringBall bounce must be on the left edge of the rightmost underwater platform.
While the bounce is occuring, setup a mid-air SpringBall Jump to escape the water and reach the door.

strats.name: Full Room Shinespark Plus SpaceJump
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to cross the room and reach a raised ledge on the right side wall.
From there, use SpaceJump to escape the water.
Carry the shinespark to the bottom of the ramp by delaying the first Choot with two Power Beam shots, killing it, or bounceballing through it.
The Choot can be shot diagonally from the middle platform, and again by running off that platform and aiming down to float above it.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Use very low jump height space jumps to carry momentum to the far side of the submerged ramp.
Both Choots must be killed.
Using Screw Attack: stay a little bit high in the water so that it remains active for the second Choot.
Using Plasma or ammo: kill the first Choot while running down the middle platform, and the second while gliding above it after spacejumping through the water.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive (Morph)
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Unmorphing with the correct timing and positioning for the Shinespark are very precise, and there are no extra frames on the Shinespark timer to work with.
Carry the shinespark to the bottom of the ramp either with a bounce ball which takes damage from the Choot, or delay the first Choot with two shots and then use a late mockball.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: East Ocean Shinespark Water Escape With Lower Choot Alive (Ice Wave Spazer)
note: Enter the room while building a shinespark and use it on the lowest part of the ramp to diagonally spark up and out of the water.
Use very low jump height space jumps to carry momentum to the far side of the submerged ramp.
Freeze the first Choot from the middle platform.
Either SpaceJump just right so as to pass above the second Choot, or freeze it as it touches Samus to pass through without losing speed.
Then shinespark up and use SpaceJump to reach the door.
strats.devNote: There is 1 unusable tile in this runway.

strats.name: Leave With Spring Ball Bounce (Space Jump)
Leave With Temporary Blue (Spring Ball Jump)
Leave With Temporary Blue (Blue Space Jump)
Shinespark
strats.note: Horizontally shinespark from the grassy patch on the ledge near the door, then jump across the platforms.

strats.name: Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
East Ocean Suitless Damage Boost Water Escape
strats.note: Find the Choot that is closest to the surface of the water, crouch jump under it and damage boost onto the dry platform to the left.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape with Ice and XRay Standup
note: Freeze the right-most ramp Choot in a way where Samus can climb on top of it and use Space Jump to escape the water.
Use a turn around to avoid knockback when making contact with the Choot to better time the use of Ice.
Freeze the Choot as far to the right (on its lowest swoop), but this method is less precise than the alternatives.
If Samus is inside the Choot when it is frozen, she can continuing moving freely.
Jump on top either in spinjump or in Morph Ball
Use XRay to standup, clipping partially into the above slope.
Use a flately jump to fall out of the wall while still keeping enough height to spacejump on top of the water and escape.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape with Ice (Left to Right)
note: Get to the right of the Choot on the rightmost platform. Spin jump up to the right, break spin while aligned with the wall, then freeze the Choot and stand on it while it is midair to the right of the stalagmite.
Jump from the Choot to the water line and space jump at the water line to the Kamer platform.

strats.name: East Ocean Space Jump Water Escape (Left to Right)
note: Standing from the rightmost platform, jump to the right of the stalagmite. Perform a midair wiggle to get to the left to the stalagmite, then precisely wall jump off of it.
Then perform a frame perfect space jump at the water line to bounce on the water over to the Kamer platform.

strats.name: Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
Suitless Frozen Choot, Spring Ball, Space Jump
note: Freeze the Choot when it swings right on its jump. Quickly get on top of it by first getting onto the pillar to the left, or with a SpringBall Jump.
Perform a precise spring ball jump to get to the far right ledge, while avoiding hitting the water surface.
While on the ledge, stand on the raised ground to the right and jump to the surface, then space jump across the water to the left.

strats.name: East Ocean Floor Jump Assist Shinecharge Right
East Ocean Floor Walljump Shinespark Right
Suitless with SpringBall Jump Mid Air
East Ocean Suitless Damage Boost Underwater Pillar
note: Crouch jump down grab to get over the first two pillars.
For the third pillar, Crouch jump to time a damage boost on the Skultera.
Right after taking damage, switch to a down grab to land on top of the pillar.
This is made easier by taking the damage boost while Morphed.

strats.name: Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Shinespark
strats.note: Enter on the left side of the doorway to reduce the amount of energy used.
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Sciser Ice Clip Door Lock Skip
note: Shoot a Super as a Sciser crawls near the top door, then freeze it mid-air and use it to clip up past the door shell.
If you don't have Morph and X-Ray, you must shoot the Super while the Sciser is on the slope near the door, not on the door itself.
strats.devNote: This doesn't seem possible to get the crab frozen at the high pixel position.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Frozen Sciser
note: The nearby Global crab can be used to exit on the left side of the door.
Exiting on the right will require travelling the Morph maze to find a local crab or two.
devNote: There is a Morphless way to jump on the crab with aim down but it feels too precise to include.
Global Crab (left side) takes 40 seconds, local crab (Right side) is 180.  Finding two left side crabs to use together is faster.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph
note: Without Springball or Gravity, it is possible to overload PLMs with the crumble blocks with bombs.
Take the first left above the waterline. Place bombs in the single tile nook on the left.

strats.name: G-Mode Morph to overload Crumble Block Plms
note: Place bombs at the far right, next to the low underwater ceiling.
To safely bomb the fast crab, wait just left of the crack on the floor where it falls.

strats.name: Leave with Runway
strats.devNote: Because the next tile is a slope into the water, it behaves like no open end.

strats.name: G-Mode Setup - Getting hit by Sciser
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Shinespark
strats.devNote: This strat is not useful in-room, but can satisfy a strat in the room before with an exit shinespark.

strats.name: Leave with Runway, Open Both Doors
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Come In Shinecharged, Leave With Spark
Come in Shinecharging, Leave With Temporary Blue
Transition with Stored Fall Speed (more speed)
Leave with Runway, Open Both Doors
